summary: Tiniest fix ever! Made as a request, fixes the Bullseye perk to give 15% paralyzing chance (as it's supposed to) instead of 16%. There's also a replacer version for the perk with a more interesting alternative: the Dragonslayer perk.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#00FF00] [size=5] Description [/size] [/color]

I made this in a couple of minutes as a request:

The Bullseye perk is supposed to give you "15% chance of paralyzing the target for a few seconds." but it actually gives you 16%. This mod fixes that.

This issue has already been fixed in the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19]USKP[/url], if you use it you don't need my mod to fix it. However, you can still use the Dragonslayer perk to replace the Bullseye perk if you don't like it that much.

[line]
[color=#00FF00] [size=5] Dragonslayer Perk [/size] [/color]

Alternatively, you can replace the Bullseye perk with a new perk I made. User Yujimbo requested me to change/modify the perk entirely because he was having issues with the paralyze effect, so I thought 'why not? this is a good time to be creative', and I came up with the Dragonslayer perk. It's my first attempt at making a new perk from scratch, so let me know what you guys think.

The perk grants a 20% chance of dealing double damage to dragons when using bows or crossbows. The reasons I decided to go with this specific creature-type oriented perk are:

- Getting to 100 in any skill should give access to a cool perk in my opinion, but the Bullseye perk isn't that great if you ask me. Don't get me wrong, it is useful in some circumstances, but I just don't find it that interesting.

- I always though that pure archers lacked the damage output needed to take down dragons. Personally I don't use any 'increased arrows/bolts damage' options from my own Arrows and Bolts Tweaks mod, I kinda like vanilla arrows/bolts damage so I didn't want to increase it. But dragons are tough opponents (as they should be) so I thought giving archers a little extra damage this way would be welcomed.

- I also based my decision on mods like [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3829]Deadly Dragons[/url], and other mods that make dragon fights harder and less frequent (like [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=16724]Skreee[/url]). For everyday fights the archery perk tree already grants +100% bow/crossbow damage with all Overdraw perks maxed out, and 3 levels on the Critical Shot perks boost critical hits, but dragon fights are supposed to be EPIC, so giving archers a boost for an epic fight made sense to me, and sounded cool too. Now Dragons will truly fear the Dovahkiin's ranged attacks.

- Last but not least, there's not a single dragon-related perk in ANY of the perk trees, kind of weird for a dragonborn not to be able to improve his/her dragon-slaying abilities... After all, The Book of the Dragonborn does say 'The Nords tell tales of Dragonborn heroes who were great dragonslayers, able to steal the power of the dragons they killed.'
[line]
[color=#00FF00] [size=5] Installation [/size] [/color]

Install either 'Bullseye Perk Fix' or 'Bullseye to Dragonslayer Perk' (only one) with NMM, or manually copy the chosen .esp file to your SkyrimData directory (and activate the .esp using the Skyrim Launcher).
